Logic.Boards

Class ChessBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • Logic.Boards.ChessBoard

  • public class ChessBoard
extends java.lang.Object
    ChessBoard Object that the game will played on. The ChessBoard is the binding link between the the Square and the Game ad contains a number of helpful methods.
    See Also:
    Square, Game

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ChessBoard(javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas displayCanvas)
      Creates a new Chessboard.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ChessBoard

        public ChessBoard(javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas displayCanvas)
        Creates a new Chessboard. The references for the Canvas i needed so we know the height/width of the display Canvas. The job of drawing is the controller job.
        Parameters:
        displayCanvas - The canvas we want to display the board on.

    • Method Detail

      • resizeSquares

        public void resizeSquares()
        Method that will change the width and height of all Squares. This should and will be used when the canvas i resized.

      • getSquares

        public Square[][] getSquares()
        Return the Array of Squares
        Returns:
        2D Array of Squares

      • getSquare

        public Square getSquare(double xPosition,
                        double yPosition)
        Get a specific Square by pixel clicked on the Canvas. This method should be used to identify the correct Square.
        Parameters:
        xPosition - The x position of the pixel clicked on the canvas.
        yPosition - The y position of the pixel clicked on the canvas.
        Returns:
        The Square clicked on by the User

      • getSquare

        public Square getSquare(Coordinate coordinate)
        Get a specific Square by providing a Coordinate object. The Coordinate object contains a x and y value and note that the top left corner will be coordinate (0,0)
        Parameters:
        coordinate - Coordinate on the board
        Returns:
        The Square on the given x/y Coordinate
